Episodes.Title: Fear of a Krabby Patty
Episodes.Plot: Plankton unleashes a new plan; to get the Krusty Krab to work 24 hours. SpongeBob thinks this is a dream, until he thinks he is being chased by killer Krabby Patties.
Episodes.Writer: Mike Bell, Paul Tibbitt, C.H. Greenblatt

Episodes.Title: Shell of a Man
Episodes.Plot: Mr. Krabs is going to a naval reunion, but molts (leaves his shell) before he goes. He asks SpongeBob to go in his shell and imitate him for the reunion.
Episodes.Writer: Mike Bell, Paul Tibbitt

Episodes.Title: The Lost Mattress
Episodes.Plot: Mr. Krabs complains that his back hurts, so SpongeBob and Patrick buy a new mattress and Squidward tries to take credit for it. They give the new mattress to Mr. Krabs, but Mr. Krabs put his money in his old mattress, which SpongeBob, Patrick, and Squidward must find while Mr. Krabs is at the hospital.
Episodes.Writer: Tim Hill, Mike Bell

Episodes.Title: Krabs vs. Plankton
Episodes.Plot: Plankton tries to steal the formula, but slips and sues Mr. Krabs. Mr. Krabs hires a lawyer, but his lawyer slips and is hurt, so SpongeBob must try to help Mr. Krabs win the case by trying to open a briefcase that has something very important in it.
Episodes.Writer: Tim Hill, Mike Bell

Episodes.Title: Skill Crane
Episodes.Plot: Mr. Krabs gets a new toy vender by the name of "Skill Crane." At first, Squidward doesn't like it, but when Mr. Krabs lets him and SpongeBob give it a try, Squidward becomes obsessed with it. Can he win anything from the Skill Crane before it ruins his life?
Episodes.Writer: Kyle McCulloch, Aaron Springer, Vincent Waller

Episodes.Title: Good Neighbors
Episodes.Plot: It's Sunday and Squidward just wants to relax. But when SpongeBob and Patrick elect him as Good Neighbor President, they won't leave him alone. Squidward installs an alarm system in which he thinks will "get rid of the threat." But when it malfunctions after SpongeBob and Patrick's apology cake is dropped on it, it goes on a rampage. Can Sponge and Pat get the house back to normal while Squidward just enjoys the rest of his Sunday?
Episodes.Writer: Mike Bell

Episodes.Title: Selling Out
Episodes.Plot: Mr. Krabs sells The Krusty Krab to a conglomerate that plans to turn it into a big corporate chain. At first the sell out brings the kind of peace and quiet Krabs always wanted. But his early retirement quickly turns into nothing more than one boring day after another, and Krabs finds himself living a life without purpose. So he takes a job as a busboy at the Krusty Krab only to find that it has been transformed into a heartless mockery of his former restaurant. With the help of SpongeBob and Sq
Episodes.Writer: Zeus Carvas, Erik Wiese, Tim Hill

Episodes.Title: Funny Pants
Episodes.Plot: Squidward has had enough of SpongeBob's incessant laughter, so he tricks his neighbor into believing that SpongeBob has a laugh-related illness. According to the made-up disease, if SpongeBob laughs one more time in the next 24 hours, his laugh box will explode and he will never laugh or giggle again. For the rest of the day, SpongeBob fights every single urge to chuckle. The next morning, SpongeBob discovers that he has completely lost the ability to laugh. Now, utterly greif stricken, all Spon
Episodes.Writer: Steven Banks, Tom King, Luke Brookshier

Episodes.Title: Enemy-In-Law
Episodes.Plot: Mr. Krabs' Mom is dating again, and it seems like things could be serious. Krabs tries to be happy for his mother, but he is absolutely horrified when he learns that the secret paramour is his arch-rival Plankton! Convinced that this just another trick aimed at getting the family formula for Krabby Patties, Krabs tries to reveal Plankton's schemes and breakup the ill-favored fling.
Episodes.Writer: Luke Brookshier, Tom King, Tim Hill

Episodes.Title: Mermaid Man & Barnacle Boy VI - The Motion Picture
Episodes.Plot: The adventures of Mermaid Man and Barnacle Boy are being told in a thrilling new motion picture. But as SpongeBob and Patrick soon learn, their heroes are not in the movie. The real Mermaid Man and Barnacle Boy were considered too old, so their filmic counterparts will be two young actors that are nothing like the heroes. SpongeBob is outraged, and he sets out to make his own version of the Mermaid Man and Barnacle Boy movie using the real guys fresh from their retirement home.
Episodes.Writer: Paul Tibbitt, Chris Mitchell, Casey Alexander

Episodes.Title: Patrick SmartPants
Episodes.Plot: When Patrick and SpongeBob are cheerfully jellyfishing, Patrick accidentally falls off a cliff. As he recovers, Patrick is now talking in complete sentences. But Patrick isn't happy with jellyfishing anymore. SpongeBob has to get the old Patrick back.
Episodes.Writer: Casey Alexander, Chris Mitchell, Tim Hill

Episodes.Title: SquidBob TentaclePants
Episodes.Plot: Sandy's experimental teleportation device malfunctions, melding SpongeBob and Squidward into one body. This makes working in the kitchen and behind the check out counter at the Krusty Krab a bit of an issue. But Squidward's main concern is his big clarinet recital that's just one day away. Unless Sandy can reverse the effects of her machine, Squidward will have to find a way to hide SpongeBob during his performance.
Episodes.Writer: Zeus  Cervas, Steven Banks, Erik Wiese

Episodes.Title: Krusty Towers
Episodes.Plot: After Mr. Krab's gets a huge hotel bill he decides that he can make a profit from opening his own. When Patrick decides to visit the hotel Mr. Krabs demands Squidward to never deny a guest even the most ridiculous request, but after Patrick frustrates Squidward so badly he quits his job. Then he decides to check into the Krusty Towers.
Episodes.Writer: Tom King, Luke Brookshier, Steven Banks

Episodes.Title: Mrs. Puff, You're Fired
Episodes.Plot: Mrs. Puff gets fired from her boating school job due to her lack of passing Spongebob. Instead, a more-intense new instructor takes her place.
Episodes.Writer: Casey Alexander, Chris Mitchell, Tim Hill

Episodes.Title: Ghost Host
Episodes.Plot: The Flying Dutchman takes up residence at SpongeBob's house where he proceeds to scare, startle and surprise SpongeBob around the clock. Eventually all the spooky shenanigans grow old, and SpongeBob is no longer afraid of the Dutchman. This creates a panic for the old ghost who now fears that he has lost his scary touch. So SpongeBob decides to lend a hand and help the Flying Dutchman learn to scare people again.
Episodes.Writer: Zeus Carvas, Erik Wiese, Tim Hill

Episodes.Title: Chimps Ahoy!
Episodes.Plot: The Chimpanzee beneficiaries of Sandy's undersea treedome are paying a visit to see what progress she has made with her inventions. But Sandy doesn't think any of her work will satisfy the chimps, and if they don't like what she's invented Sandy could lose her funding forcing her to leave Bikini Bottom. SpongeBob and Patrick decide to help their distraught friend by taking over her work and finishing her inventions.
Episodes.Writer: Luke Brookshier, Tom King, Steven Banks

Episodes.Title: Whale of a Birthday
Episodes.Plot: Mr. Krabs wants to give his daughter Pearl the best birthday ever. While he works on the party, SpongeBob is assigned the task of figuring out what Pearl would like for a present. So he trails her through the Bikini Bottom mall and takes note of everything she thinks is "Coral." Once Pearl arrives at her party she is horrified to find that her dad's miserly ways have won out again. What was supposed to be the most fun and fabulous event ended up cheap and lame. It looks like Pearl's birthday wil
Episodes.Writer: Luke Brookshier, Tom King, Paul Tibbitt

Episodes.Title: Karate Island
Episodes.Plot: SpongeBob receives an invitation to take part in a competition on mysterious Karate Island for the chance to be crowned "King of Karate." SpongeBob and Sandy arrive at Karate Island and it turns out that it was just all a set-up to make SpongeBob buy real estate.
Episodes.Writer: Casey Alexander, Chris Mitchell, Steven Banks

Episodes.Title: All That Glitters
Episodes.Plot: When a customer orders the one thing that no one has ordered for years, the monster krabby patty, SpongeBob tries to lift it, but old Spat cracks in two. So he sells every single thing he owns [plus his clothes] for a new spatula, but the spatula refuses to flip a single patty, so SpongeBob tries to get his old spatula back. Will Spat forgive him? Will SpongeBob ever be dressed again?
Episodes.Writer: Erik Wiese, Zeus Cervas, Steven Banks

Episodes.Title: Wishing You Well
Episodes.Plot: Mr. Krabs makes SpongeBob go down the new wishing well after experiencing one for himself, and Patrick and Squidward accidentally join in. So, will they be able to get out and watch everybody's wishes come true? Or will Mr. Krabs just make them stay down there when he enjoys the money?
Episodes.Writer: Tom King, Luke Brookshier, Steven Banks
